body: Only two of the template variable issues were because of things in this repo, the rest were caused by an issue in the `respond` action where template data wasn't being passed to the templater. It's since been fixed, so I'm going to go ahead and merge this.

> Websockets sometimes require a refresh between steps, but they reflect the appropriate step each time after the refresh

You don't need to keep noting this 😉 it isn't related to the course. But so I know - is this on `github.com`, or `lab.github.com`? If the former, we can't do anything about it. If the latter, can you open a separate issue in `github/learning-lab`?

I've gone through the course and these all seem to be fixed now. I think a deploy yesterday didn't actually go through, because a lot of the persisting bugs should have been fixed and _were_ fixed after a deploy this morning.

I've also fixed the other things that are new. Going to close this out 👍

Unrelated, but I was hoping to do both items in the same PR. 

https://github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github/blob/master/responses/pr-succeeds.md uses user.username as expected (following up on your [comment](https://github.com/github/learning-lab/issues/536#issuecomment-405685863) ). 

Do you know why this might not appear as an appropriate @mention?

> Is there a way for us to edit this before merging?

Sure is! I'll do that.

> Do you know why this might not appear as an appropriate @mention?

You'll just need the `@` symbol before it.
@JasonEtco Oh! Sorry, I was referring to another file. Can you take a look at the recent commit and then merge?
@github/learning-engineering I'd love to hear your thoughts on these tickets. In terms of value, feasibility, and alternative approaches :)
👀 @alebourne for the report
Thanks for the PR, @DEGoodmanWilson! Sorry it took so long to get it merged.

This is pretty much done, but I'm requesting your review @JamesMGreene for two reasons:
- it's my first go at course preferences, so I'd appreciate the extra 👀 
- it's waiting for https://github.com/github/learning-lab/pull/903
Awesome! I noticed the same thing in https://github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github/issues/11

Since the switch to Liquid as the templating engine for responses, we can use [the `remove` filter](http://shopify.github.io/liquid/filters/remove/) which does exactly what we want. I think that'll do it @brianamarie, but its worth testing to be sure.

I am not sure if I will have bandwidth to test this this week, but I'd like to. @hectorsector @ppremk or other @githubtraining/learning-engineering if you have the bandwidth to test this, that would be very helpful to getting this merged 👍
@hectorsector @githubtraining/learning-engineering Is there anything I can do to help, (other than test which I'm not sure how to do)?
Thank you @hectorsector!

Thanks @amyschoen for making these fixes. I'll give @hectorsector and @crichID some time to check it out, but, if since I know they are _pretty_ swamped, I will plan on merging these changes in tomorrow. ❤️

You're welcome, and sounds good.  I did give @crichID a heads up on a call earlier today that I'd be messing with some of this stuff.  I was hoping to also make the links open up a new tab, but I did enough trial and error combined with research to realize that isn't currently an option with how GHE renders links.

#### :red_circle: 1 errors found in the config file.

```
- "8" [Open a pull request].actions[8] Action of type `createPullRequestComment` does not exist
```

#### :red_circle: 1 errors found in the config file.

```
- "8" [Open a pull request].actions[8] Action of type `createPullRequestComment` does not exist
```
c44c28a uses the new suggested changes action and it works locally 👍 I'm not sure I want to keep its use in this course, mostly just wanted to try it out 😄

> Usage/metrics check - are people taking/completing the course? If not, why?

This is our most popular course, probably because of [its placement](https://github.com/github/learning-engineering/issues/164#issuecomment-466165079). The step completion follows a pattern which I consider "normal". It doesn't seem like there's any cliffs anywhere in the completion.

> We could try starting the course with a brief terminology video for repository, issue, branch, commit, and pull request.

Thanks to @a-a-ron we've now got 📖 icons with definitions each time a new term appears.
Tested all updates locally, merging now!
Taken care of in #19

@crichID the course doesn't use VS Code for pull requests, only for cloning, branching, staging, committing, and pushing. The PRs are done on GitHub. The step the learner is describing is referring to the GitHub UI (see it in [my own repo](https://github.com/hectorsector/github-slideshow/pull/3#pullrequestreview-226321330)). 

I'm 👍 for clarifying the instructions if that's not already clear, but I'm also OK with using the [Pull Request extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=GitHub.vscode-pull-request-github) for VS Code if that's the route we want to go.
@hectorsector @JasonEtco Do you know how I can reference the URL to the pages site correctly? I've commented by the line that needs changed, but I'm not sure the right way to do it.

This is ready for review! I'd like to 🚢 with 1 👍 but will consider merging without review to make sure this can be on ghe tomorrow. cc @githubtraining/learning-engineering @githubtraining/trainers  for 👀
I'm going to go ahead and merge this in under the assumption that @brianamarie has already 🍰
@crichID I'm going to go ahead and close this out but please reopen if I missed the intent of the issue.

Your draft course version was created!


You can edit it using the Course Builder UI: https://lab.github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github/admin/release/builder
